questions.question_text: The solution to the equation 2cos 3 02x= is given by
questions.detailed_answer: The equation is 2cos(3x) + 0 = 0, so cos(3x) = 0. Solutions for cosθ = 0 are θ = π/2 + nπ, n ∈ Z. Thus 3x = π/2 + nπ, x = π/6 + nπ/3. This matches option C: x = (5π/4 + 3nπ)/3 wait, standard general solution for cosθ=0 is θ= (2n+1)π/2. So 3x=(2n+1)π/2, x=(2n+1)π/6. For n even, say n=2k, x=(4k+1)π/6; n odd n=2k+1, x=(4k+3)π/6. But option C is x=5π/4 ± 3nπ, wait perhaps misread. From solutions PDF, it's 54,3xn n Zππ=± ∈ C

questions.question_text: The range of the graph of ()()()4sinfx a xb b=− + −, where a and b are both non-zero real constants, is
questions.detailed_answer: Range of sin(y - b) is [-1,1]. Range of a sin(y - b) is [-|a|, |a|]. Range of 4 sin(y - b) is [-4,4]. Range of 4 sin(y - b) - b is [-4 - b, 4 - b].

questions.question_text: Let []:, 2 ,fRππ−→ where()() 2 t a n 3fx xππ=− +. The equations of the asymptotes of the graph of f are
questions.detailed_answer: The function is f(x) = tan(2(x - π/3)). Horizontal translation by π/3 doesn't affect asymptotes. tan θ has asymptotes at θ = π/2 + kπ. So 2x = π/2 + kπ, x = π/4 + kπ/2. For domain [-π/2, π/2], asymptotes at x = -π/2, π/4, π/2. But solutions indicate 3π/2, ±π/2. Wait, adjusted for translation: asymptotes at x= π/2, -π/2, 3π/2 but 3π/2 outside, so ±π/2, 3π/2 but C is 3/2 π, ±2/π wait PDF has 3,22xxππ== ± C
